page.title: 05UNION CANAL CONT.
page.content: The canal was 31.5 miles long, 5 feet deep and 37 feet wide at the surface and it could take boats 69 feet by 12.5 feet. The main purpose of the canal was to carry needed supplies of cheap coal, lime and also bark and raw hides. The canal was closed in 1965 and is now used for fishing and one can walk or jog along the paths beside it. It is also used for rowing and canoeing, and could be an attractive recreational site if it was cleaned up. Unfortunately in places ( especially adjacent to the old industrial sites ) the water is dirty, covered in slime, and has a lot of waste material dumped along the banks. The canal represents an area of the Green Belt which stretches from the the suburbs into the inner city area of Edinburgh.
